com.estimote.sdk.connection

Class BeaconConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.estimote.sdk.connection.BeaconConnection

  • public class BeaconConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for reading and changing beacon's configuration. It establishes connection to the beacon and authorizes access to it.

    In order to successfully authorize access to beacon, beacon needs to be registered to your Estimote Cloud. You need to provide Estimote Cloud credentials via EstimoteSDK.initialize(Context, String, String) prior to connecting to beacon.

    Exposes methods to change beacon's UUID, major, minor, advertising advertisingInterval, broadcasting transmitPower, transmitPower modes values. You can only change those values only if there is established connection to beacon.

    It is very important to close() connection when it is not needed.

    Usage: 

       BeaconConnection connection = new BeaconConnection(context, beacon, new BeaconConnection.ConnectionCallback() {
      @Override public void onConnected(BeaconInfo beaconInfo) {
       Log.d(TAG, "Authenticated to beacon. Info: " + beaconInfo);
       Log.d(TAG, "Advertising internal: " + connection.advertisingIntervalMillis().get());
       Log.d(TAG, "Broadcasting transmitPower: " + connection.broadcastingPower().get());
     }

      @Override public void onAuthenticationError(EstimoteDeviceException exception) {
       Log.d(TAG, "Authentication Error: " + exception);
     }

      @Override public void onDisconnected() {
       Log.d(TAG, "Disconnected");
     }
   });

   connection.authenticate();

   // Interact with beacon.

   // You can update beacon's properties in following way:
   connection.edit()
     .set(connection.proximityUuid(), newUuid)
     .set(connection.major(), newMajor)
     .set(connection.minor(), newMinor)
     .commit(new BeaconConnection.WriteCallback() {
         @Override public void onSuccess() {}
         @Override public void onError(EstimoteDeviceException exception) {}
     });

   // Do not forget to close connection.
   connection.close();
    Use DeviceConnection obtained from DeviceConnectionProvider.

      • temperature

        public Property<java.lang.Float> temperature()
        Property for reading temperature value from beacon. Value is reported in Celsius.

        Note that Property.get() will return cached value. If you want to read most up to date temperature value, do use Property.getAsync(Property.Callback).

        This property is read-only. If you try to write a value, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

        Returns:
        Beacon's temperature property (read-only).
        See Also:
        temperatureCalibration()

      • temperatureCalibration

        public Property<java.lang.Float> temperatureCalibration()
        Calibrates the beacon’s thermometer sensor.

        Beacons are basically calibrated out of the box, but additional manual calibration is recommended in order to minimize measurement error. When the sensor is not calibrated, measurement error is ±4 Celsius degrees. After calibration it’s ±2 Celsius degrees.

        To perform calibration you need to keep the beacon at room temperature for a couple of minutes. Use a separate thermometer to read the actual value (in Celsius degrees) and pass it.

        This property is write only. If you try to read it, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

        Returns:
        Beacon's temperature calibration (write-only).

      • motionDetectionEnabled

        public Property<java.lang.Boolean> motionDetectionEnabled()
        Enables or disables the accelerometer allowing to detect if beacon is in motion.
        Returns:
        Beacon's accelerometer enabled property.

      • motionState

        public Property<MotionState> motionState()
        A flag indicating if the beacon is in motion or not.

        This property is read only. If you try to write to it, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

        Returns:
        Beacon's accelerometer state (in motion or not in motion).

      • secureUUID

        public Property<java.lang.Boolean> secureUUID()
        Property for enabling/disabling Secure UUID.

        Read more @see What security features does Estimote offer? How does Secure UUID work?

        Returns:
        Beacon's secure UUID state (is enabled or disabled).

      • eddystoneUrl

        public Property<java.lang.String> eddystoneUrl()
        Eddystone-URL's URL property can be at max 17 characters. Note that some predefined substrings can be treated as one special character. Those are: http://www. https://www. http:// https:// .com .com/ .org .org/ .edu .edu/ .net .net/ .info .info/ .biz .biz/ .gov .gov/
        Returns:
        Eddystone's URL property.

      • getInternalEstimoteCloud

      • setMotionListener

        public void setMotionListener(Property.Callback<MotionState> callback)
        Sets listener to beacon's motion changes. When beacon starts to move, information about it will be dispatched immediately. Information about beacon's no movements will be dispatched after 2 seconds of remaining still. This method should be called when connection is established (@isConnected() returns true). Call it with a null callback object and listener will be unregistered (no need to be connected is this case).
        Parameters:
        callback - Motion listener callback.
